title: Social Media
description: Tasked to design a new social media network, inspired by existing platforms like Facebook, TikTok, Twitter, and Instagram, that connects individuals and businesses.

title: Betway Aviator Analysis
description: This project aims to analyze a popular gambling game to uncover patterns that can potentially increase the win rate for players. By leveraging data collection techniques such as screen scraping, we gathered extensive data on betting outcomes and odds. The analysis was conducted using Python, Beautiful Soup for web scraping, and Jupyter Notebook for data visualization and exploration - also side Pandasa and more

title: Ecommerce Connect
description: A e-commerce website for both buyers and sells. The web application has a Content Management System (CMS) for buyers to see their inventory, orders, stuff administrative tools and more. It also offer financial records and charts to help businesses to better manage and understand their financies.

Ecommerce Connect was establish to help small to medium business owner to have a centralized platform where users can find them - It's main audience being the informational section, An unexplored, cash heavy  market who can't meet most populate platforms high start up fees.

timeline.description: Convert an existing static website into a dynmamic web application (HTML & Javscript -> Angular, MongoDB & ExpressJS). This process was give basic funtionality to ensure the new feature we working, at this stage - the application was still mainly run on local devices. Introducted feature: Login and Registration, Recent view items, New styling, Search, Recently search and recently viewed history, Connection with api and database, Product description view,& environment file for the api link

Introduction of sellers portal. The process of dividing the application into sellers version and customer version. This is the phase of allowing seller to edit and their profiles and products ad they see fit. Feature Introducted: Order and sell analytics represented using graphs, Ability to accept and decline orders, Sellers being able to edit thier profiles, Custumers being able to see seller profiles, Customers being able to checkout

Bug fixes and existing feature improvements. Introducted feature: Add business profiles - to help large organisations better manage their stuff, Seller order filtering to better pioritize their orders, Add business portal to help seller better understand platform and tools, Customers can add description to their order(s) - to help seller understand their order.

title: Rydly
description: Rydly is a dynamic ride-sharing service that refines the way users commute, connecting private vehicle owners with individuals sharing similar routes. Rydly offers carpool services, optimized journeys for a more sustainable and cost-effective travel experience, Emergency services like SOS dispatch, ride sharing and live tracking for both driver and commuter, Communication features like on platform live chat and calls, Intergration with state services for account verification and auditting, On demand invoices and trip details, Different ride and pricing options to meet individual needs.

timeline.description: Introduction to the team and project. Member are made familiar to the tech stack being used, given time to familiarise themselves with the code based of the already existing project, individual goal setting and given an clear vision of what is expected from each individual involved.

title: Travel Vista
description: A group project for Richfield Hackathon using Trip Advisor API, Angular, Tailwind and PhP. Created to help travelers plan their ideal adventure by get access to flights,restaurants, hotels and attractions. Website has able to also save card information, trip history and profile page. I was responsible for managing the team and front-end development, and teaching and helping the team with Angular.

timeline.description: Pre-planning process. All dependencies and file related to QR Code scanning are shared, these will be the initual project for everyone involved. The initual plan for the project was to use PHP and mySQL, but later changed. This is because hackathon topics were changed and as such, the project change from using PHP and mySQL to using Angular and MongoDB. The application was given general styling based on Figma design, this include feeatures like the Navbar, make application mobile responsive, global styles for font and color and linking external links for fonts, logos and more.

Add tailwind for easier styling. This was need for a large time, mainly full of beginner developers who are unfamiliar with the tools beginning used. The homepage was also completed at this stage. This was done to help those who are unfimiliar with the tools get a framework to use moving forward. This is the point where everyone was assign a page they are responsible for based on a figma design

Add ability to search [done by me], view hotels, footer, about section regarding the organisation, user page for managing account (wallet, setting, history) [done by me], explore page[done by me], dark mode [done by me], testimonials, sign in and sign up page and splash page [done by me].

title: Code Pilot
description: This website takes in code and fixes it using chatGPT3/gpt-3. The API has been disabled so contact me if you want to try it out and I'll temporarily activate it
